newsitem.title: FRANCE: More strikes likely at French airline.
newsitem.headline: More strikes likely at French airline.

text.p: Union representatives walked out of a meeting with the management of Air France Europe late on Tuesday, indicating further strikes ahead for the state-owned airline, French radios said.

The stoppage highlighted labour disputes dogging French airlines on the day that Air France took a key step towards a full merger with the former Air Inter, set for September, leasing the domestic carrier's activities and staff.
Delegates from three main unions successively walked out of the meeting saying their miniumum demands were not being met, Radio France-Info said.
The union leaders told reporters they would hold a general assembly of members on Wednesday morning at Paris' Orly airport and further strikes were possible.
The unionists from the domestic airline are protesting against conditions under which they are being merged with big brother Air France as deregulation takes effect on European Union domestic routes.
Air France Europe had to cancel almost all flights from Orly on Tuesday morning. Normal services were eventually restored in the afternoon after wage negotiations began, the company said.

The strike, blamed by unions on the absence of negotiations on unifying Air France Europe's more generous pay and employment terms with those of parent company Air France, caused misery for thousands of travellers on the busy Easter weekend.
Management says terms need to be brought more into line with those of lower-cost competitors such as British Airways.
